assessments.status_rationale: Today’s news bullets do not reference Congressional passage/signature of any federal Medicare telehealth extension through at least 2026-12-31. Deadline (2026-03-15) has not yet arrived, so the prediction remains unresolved.

A CNBC item notes Trump 'threatens 100% tariffs,' but the prediction requires an announced and implemented new/increased tariff on Canadian-origin goods with an incremental +25pp for a defined product category (e.g., via proclamation/USTR/Federal Register/CBP guidance). The provided bullets do not establish implementation, product scope, or a formal tariff action, so it remains pending.
No bullet indicates Canada has published and begun applying retaliatory trade measures against the U.S. with stated annual import coverage ≥ CAD 5B. Deadline (2026-06-30) is in the future.

None of the listed items reference ENISA or CERT-EU issuing a public advisory about a 'wiper' malware campaign targeting Poland’s energy sector with mitigations/IOCs. Deadline (2026-03-31) not yet reached.

There is no bullet-level evidence that the SEC has ended (dismissal/settlement/final judgment) a high-profile enforcement action against Coinbase, Kraken, or Binance.US. Deadline (2026-06-30) is still ahead.

Today’s bullets mention upcoming Big Tech earnings generally, but do not report a Meta Reality Labs quarterly operating loss figure for Q1/Q2 2026. The prediction concerns a future earnings release window (by 2026-08-15).

No news bullet or filing information is provided about Berkshire Hathaway’s Kraft Heinz stake or any Form 13F changes. The relevant comparison quarter (ended 2025-12-31) and filing deadline (2026-11-15) indicate this is not yet decidable.

None of the bullets indicate the FDA has granted and a developer has publicly disclosed a Breakthrough Device Designation for an implanted BCI intended to restore communication and/or upper-limb motor function. Deadline (2026-12-31) is far in the future.
